meanings.definition: To tear or pull out forcibly
meanings.sent1: The dentist evulsed the decayed tooth quickly.
meanings.sent2: She evulsed the weed from the garden with determination.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy evulsed the sock and ran around with it.
meanings.sent4: The storm evulsed the trees from the ground, leaving a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The magician evulsed the card from the deck with a flick of his wrist.

meanings.definition: Torn or pulled out by force
meanings.sent1: The evulsed tooth caused him great pain.
meanings.sent2: She examined the evulsed plant carefully.
meanings.sent3: The evulsed page fluttered to the ground in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The evulsed wires dangled dangerously from the ceiling.
meanings.sent5: The evulsed nail lay on the floor, waiting to be picked up.
